image.altText: A member of parliament on his feet in the chamber to ask a question while holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

title.children: Breaking: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days

image.altText: A firefighter with a fire hose sprays a smouldering tree stump.

props.synopsis: Authorities are warning people to be prepared as hot and windy conditions sweep across the state in what the CFS says will be a "challenging day" for firefighters.

title.children: Firefighters tackle grass blaze ahead of 'significant day' in South Australia

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and tattoos on her arm wearing a black singlet smiles while sitting at a bar

props.synopsis: Police say they have "grave concerns" for a woman who has not been seen for more than two weeks in outback South Australia.

title.children: New search for missing 41-year-old woman in outback SA

image.altText: driver lifting two fingers from a car steering wheel

props.synopsis: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

title.children: Experiment shows uncertain future for courtesy wave

image.altText: A young man in blue walking with head down

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

title.children: Man charged with Tim Picton assault granted bail

image.altText: A man holding a cricket shirt in front of a beach.

props.synopsis: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

title.children: 'They were a band of brothers': The largely untold story of Australia's first touring cricket team

image.altText: Anthony Nocera arms crossed against a dark background on location at State Theatre South Australia

props.synopsis: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

title.children: Rising SA playwright's late fiance 'lives on' in emotional theatre debut

image.altText: GettyImages-2253824052

props.synopsis: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest "battle of the sexes". The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

title.children: 'Happy it's over': Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka in new 'battle of the sexes'

image.altText: Dairy cows stand behind a fence.

props.synopsis: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.

title.children: Emerging virtual fencing tech could help save cattle trapped in bushfires

image.altText: A graphic showing a vial of the Mounjaro weight loss drug next to three Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

title.children: 'Pesky Aussie laws' comment sparks scrutiny of weight-loss treatment marketing

image.altText: An old barn with a cracked floor and gutted out on the left, refurbished with lights and bar on the right.

props.synopsis: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

title.children: Historic riverside Nor' West Bend open to public after decades of restoration

image.altText: Two women stand in front of three camels, the woman on the right holds a baby goat.

props.synopsis: The far west of New South Wales is playing host to a number of international visitors who are falling in love with outback farm life.

title.children: International visitors drawn to outback farm life

image.altText: Emma Johnston smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

title.children: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor dies, aged 52

image.altText: Australian Test batter Usman Khawaja looks to the sky as he walks off after losing his wicket.

props.synopsis: Usman Khawaja will play in the Ashes finale at the SCG, but Australian coach Andrew McDonald remains in the dark about the 39-year-old's future beyond that.

title.children: Khawaja guaranteed for SCG, future unclear after that

image.altText: Climber Sarah Larcombe hanging by her arms off a rock wall. The Australian outback is in the background.

props.synopsis: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

title.children: After Sarah Larcombe fell off Arapiles, healing her bones was just the beginning

image.altText: military and emergency workers stand beside a train as people climb out

props.synopsis: Another five people are in a critical condition after the Interoceanic Train detailed in the southern state of Oaxana.

title.children: At least 13 dead after train derails in Mexico, authorities say

image.altText: A two-seater glider with two people inside.

props.synopsis: A woman in her 50s was taking an "air experience" flight along with an instructor when they crashed during the take-off towing phase, as her husband watched.

title.children: 'Air experience' student killed in crash during glider's launch phase

image.altText: caravans in a row

props.synopsis: Anger is growing after revelations the corporate watchdog failed to investigate allegations against luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV.

title.children: Caravan customers furious ASIC ignored whistleblower before collapse

image.altText: A Palestinian carries aid supplies that entered Gaza

props.synopsis: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

title.children: NGOs fear lifesaving Gaza aid will be blocked under new Israeli rules

image.altText: A house-sized bluestone castle sits in a residential street; fit with a drawbridge and flying flag.

props.synopsis: They say "a man's home is his castle" but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

title.children: 'A dream come true': Father builds castle with moat and dungeon for son

image.altText: Shane Warne smiles happily.

props.synopsis: Test your knowledge with questions about Shane Warne, Frank Sinatra and Australia's first stamp.

title.children: Quiz: How well do you remember this week in history?

image.altText: A large tower, with several large clocks visible on top of it, seen from ground level.

props.synopsis: It's among the world's most photographed landmarks, a symbol of the United Kingdom and an engineering marvel. And for London's Big Ben the most important night of the year is fast approaching.

title.children: Inside Big Ben, a London icon that's been ringing since 1859

image.altText: A naked woman leans on a bed.

props.synopsis: Few epitomised French chic like Brigitte Bardot, the doe-eyed beauty whose sensuality rocked a post-war world.

title.children: Brigitte Bardot, the French star you 'had to see to believe'

image.altText: Celestial V70 enjoys a Hobart sunrise.

props.synopsis: The yacht race has entered the fourth day, after Master Lock Comanche claimed line honours late on Sunday.

title.children: 'Beat them by a minute': Nervous wait for overall Sydney to Hobart winner

image.altText: hands on steering wheel

props.synopsis: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

title.children: Experiment shows uncertain future for courtesy wave

image.altText: A man works at his desk using video editing software

props.synopsis: Would those classic black-and-white films be the same if viewed in full colour?

title.children: Debate about colouring old films is not black and white

image.altText: myanmar election

props.synopsis: Myanmar's election has been widely dismissed as a sham by many governments and human rights activists who have said the military will use proxy candidates to legitimise their rule.

title.children: Low voter turnout for first Myanmar elections since military coup

image.altText: A person scrapes bees from a board with a comb.

props.synopsis: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

title.children: Half of Canberra's beehives could be wiped out in two years. Here's why

image.altText: Aerial view of broken bridge.

props.synopsis: Earlier this year, a once-in-a-century flood devastated Ingham and cut the main supply route between Cairns and Townsville. Now, as intense rainfall once again triggers multiple warnings and floods roads across northern Queensland, communities are taking steps to prevent another food shortage.

title.children: How food security was shored up in FNQ this flood season

image.altText: Australia's Travis Head stands on the pitch with his helmet on, raising his bat as he gets to a milestone in a Test.

props.synopsis: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

title.children: Travis Head not fazed on opening role in future

image.altText: Katie Pahlow catches a wave while surfing in Lombok, Indonesia

props.synopsis: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

title.children: Why a growing number of older women are living out their surf dream

image.altText: Participants smiling in a boxing class.

props.synopsis: One in three adults experience social isolation in what experts say is a "dangerous" issue in society. One suburban boxing group is working to tackle the issue, focused on the LGBTQIA+ community more at risk of loneliness.

title.children: This queer Perth boxing class is a hit in tackling loneliness

image.altText: Maddy Langabeer on the left with another woman next to her, both wearing hats and CWA aprons, smiling with scones.

props.synopsis: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

title.children: 'More than just tea and scones': Why young members are joining city's CWA

image.altText: A car crashed into a house.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man was taken to hospital after crashing his car into a house in Kurunjang. He failed a breath test at the scene.

title.children: Drink driver crashes car into living room of house in Melbourne's west
